items.question_text: Problem P: \( 4-5+6= \) Problem Q: \( 4+5 \times 6= \) Which calculation should you do first in each problem?
items.misconception_name: Carries out operations from left to right regardless of priority order

C.misconception_name: Performs addition ahead of any other operation

D.misconception_name: Applies BIDMAS in strict order (does not realize addition and subtraction, and multiplication and division, are of equal priority)

items.question_text: Tom and Katie are discussing the order of operations Tom says: \( 0.1-0.2 \div 0.3 \equiv 0.1-(0.2 \div 0.3) \) Katie says: \( 0.1-0.2 \div 0.3 \equiv 0.2 \div 0.3-0.1 \) Who is correct?
items.misconception_name: Carries out operations from left to right regardless of priority order

B.misconception_name: Carries out operations from left to right regardless of priority order

C.misconception_name: Performs subtraction right to left if priority order means doing a calculation to the right first

D.misconception_name: Carries out operations from left to right regardless of priority order

items.misconception_name: Carries out operations from left to right regardless of priority order

D.misconception_name: Carries out operations from left to right regardless of priority order

items.misconception_name: When solving an equation, uses the same operation rather than the inverse

A.text: ![A function machine showing x as the input then +5 then squaring to give 14 as the output. Then a reverse function machine underneath showing 14 (the output) now as the input square root and then -5]()
A.misconception_name: Does not follow the arrows through a function machine, changes the order of the operations asked.

B.text: ![A function machine showing 14 as the input then squaring and +5 to give the output]()
B.misconception_name: When solving an equation, uses the same operation rather than the inverse.

C.text: ![A function machine showing x as the input then squaring then +5 to give 14 as the output. Then a reverse function machine underneath showing 14 (the output) now as the input -5 and then square root]()

D.text: ![A function machine showing x as the input then x2 then +5 to give 14 as the output. Then a reverse function machine underneath showing 14 (the output) now as the input -5 and then divide by 2]()
D.misconception_name: Mixes up squaring and multiplying by 2 or doubling
